attributes.action: Allow Royal Palace Staff to wear rememberance poppies while performing their duties
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It is apparent that following national newspaper reports (The Sun Saturday 8th November 2008) that royal palace staff are prohibited from wearing rememberance poppies that legislation is required to enshrine the right to wear a rememberance poppy in the time leading up to rememberance day.
Military and formal dress codes should also be amended accordingly.
